title: 3 Easy Ways to Open a Terminal Window on a Mac

steps.title: Open the Launchpad.
steps.content: Open the Launchpad . This looks like a square holding 9 colored tiles.

steps.title: Type terminal in the search bar.
steps.content: Type terminal in the search bar. If needed, click the search bar at the top first. Results will load as you type.

steps.title: Click Terminal.
steps.content: Click Terminal . The Terminal window will open. You can use the Terminal to open applications and troubleshoot your Mac.

steps.title: Open the Finder.
steps.content: Open the Finder . This looks like the blue and silver face icon.

steps.title: Click Go in the menu bar.
steps.content: Click Go in the menu bar. It's at the top of the screen. A drop-down menu will open.

steps.title: Click Utilities.
steps.content: Click Utilities . You can find this towards the bottom of the drop-down menu. [1] X Research source Alternatively, you can press ⇧ Shift + ⌘ + U to quickly open the Utilities folder.

steps.title: Scroll down and double-click Terminal.
steps.content: Scroll down and double-click Terminal . The Terminal window will open. For quick access to the Terminal in the future, you can add it to the Dock .

steps.title: Click the Spotlight icon.
steps.content: Click the Spotlight icon. It's the magnifying glass in the upper-right corner of the screen. Alternatively, you can press ⌘ + space to quickly open Spotlight.

steps.title: Type terminal in the search field.
steps.content: Type terminal in the search field. Results will load as you type.

steps.title: Click Terminal.
steps.content: Click Terminal . The Terminal window will open.
